ARTICLE.TITLE: The Times view on travel to France: Quarantine Quandries
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Any government wishes to avoid policies that are disruptive, draconian and costly. The decision to impose quarantine restrictions on travellers arriving from France meets those criteria. From 4am today, anyone arriving in Britain from France is required to self-isolate for 14 days or risk a fine. The same requirement applies to travellers arriving from the Netherlands, Monaco, Malta, the Turks and Caicos islands and Aruba.

The speed of the decision left many British holidaymakers with an unenviable choice. They had to decide whether to continue with their vacation and face quarantine restrictions on their return, or pay punitive prices to come back early by air, sea or rail, even supposing that they were able to get tickets.
